title: Nuevo Leon Safe Houses
name: Nuevo Leon Safe Houses
description: This data presents safe houses in Nuevo Leon, Mexico.

properties.basictitle: Casino Royale Lookout Arrested in Nuevo Leon, Mexico
properties.basic incident details: 09/18/2011: On Sunday, at a safe house in Santa Catarina, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, Luis Adan Gomez Vazquez alias "El Gordo," boss of the Los Zetas in Santa Catarina, was arrested for acting as a lookout during the Casino Royale arson in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon that occurred on 08/25/2011.

properties.basictitle: One Man Killed in Militants Safe Houses in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, Mexico
properties.basic incident details: 09/29/2011: On Thursday, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, armed militants fired upon and killed an unidentified man in a safe houses in Colonia Independencia on Calle Jose R. Pena. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

properties.basictitle: One Make Body Recovered in a Safe Houses in Monterrey
properties.basic incident details: 09/30/2011: On Friday afternoon, at 1325, Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, Mexican Army Officials recover the dead body of an individual at a safe house on Calle Jose R. Pena. The Army Officials received an anonymous call, which lead them to the body.  The man appeared to have been tortured and executed by gun fire. No casualties were reported in the military operation.

properties.basictitle: Civil Force Personnel Arrest Kidnappers and Free Hostage in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon
properties.basic incident details: 10/28/2011: On Friday afternoon at 1340, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, Civil Force personnel arrested five alleged kidnappers and freed a hostage in a safe house in Calle Azteca, Colonia Carmen Serdan. The alleged kidnappers were 24-year-old Jesus Santiago Sanchez, 29-year-old Edgar Vera Martinez, 22-year-old Samuel Reyna Hernandez, 27-year-old Eloy Torres Armendano, and 20-year-old Juan Manuel Mendoza Salas. The police officers seized 10 firearms, including rifles and pistols, more than 1,000 rounds of various caliber ammunition, loaded magazines, handcuffs, two vehicles, including one Mercedes Benz, tactical equipment, and communication equipment. Suspects fired upon the police when they came to arrest them but the officers apprehended them. The hostage had signs of torture on his body. No casualties were reported. No damages were reported.

properties.basictitle: Three Alleged Kidnappers Arrested at Safe House in Nuevo Leon
properties.basic incident details: 11/10/2011: On Thursday on Calle Roma, Colonia Andalucia, Apodaca, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, three alleged kidnappers were arrested by Mexican police at a safe house for the kidnapping of two victims, one 60-year-old doctor and a 24-year-old son of a merchant. The individuals arrested were 36-year-old Marco Antonio Cisneros Ortiz "El Guero" or "El Teacher," 22-year-old Gustavo Israel Castillo Romero, and 19-year-old Oscar Alejandro Chairez Alanis. No casualties were reported.
